heading: mmm-mmm hard
subheading: the label said vegetable beef, but consumers in at least 13 states found a bonus item, too: strips of metal in the soup. so campbell soup co. was forced to recall 109,000 pounds -- about a single day's production -- of its campbell's healthy request vegetable beef condensed soup on friday. company officials offered no explanation for how the metal shards found their way into those red-and-white, 10.5-ounce cans. but at least they had the good taste not to suggest that perhaps the metal contained minerals beneficial to the customer.
author: wired staff
